item.title: March 10, 2020 - Minimal March - Passing data between Blazor components and unit testing
item.description:
Fritz continues working on the Blazor Components, using a Chromebook with vim and continuing to demonstrate active .NET development using just a command-line set of tools. In this episode, he works on passing data and events between components.
21:08 - What are your views on vim vs VS Code at the moment? 29:29 - Have you tried the new xunit logger in the bunit? 35:22 - Shouldn't you use a service to pass data between view components? 47:20 - Why not keep the warnings and solve them eventually? 1:36:11 - Is there a good video or place to look to move your project to Devops for building and deploying? 1:41:11 - I don't know much about to integrate unit testing in .NET projects. What's the best place to getting started with it? 1:44:53 - So here's the real question: mstest or xunit? 2:23:47 - I have a project created in Razor. How difficult it would be to migrate it to Blazor if possible?
Source code at: https://github.com/FritzAndFriends/BlazorWebFormsComponents
Broadcasted live on Twitch -- Watch live at https://www.twitch.tv/csharpfritz
item.author: (Jeffrey T. Fritz)

item.title: Cloudflare and Apple design a new privacy-friendly internet protocol – TechCrunch
item.description: Engineers at Cloudflare and Apple say they’ve developed a new internet protocol that will shore up one of the biggest holes in internet privacy that many don’t know even exists. Dubbed Oblivious DNS-over-HTTPS, or ODoH for short, the new protocol makes it far more difficult for internet…

item.title: Asynchronous JavaScript in ~10 Minutes - Callbacks, Promises, and Async/Await
item.description:
The asynchronous nature of JavaScript to understanding the language. You'll find the use of callbacks, promises, and async/await in code that you write every day as a JavaScript developer. In this JavaScript tutorial, you'll learn about all three in about 10 minutes.
00:00 - Intro 01:15 - Callbacks 03:20 - Error First Callback 05:00 - Promises 10:00 - Async/Await ____________________________________________

item.title: Improving DNS Privacy with Oblivious DoH in 1.1.1.1
item.description: Oblivious DoH (ODoH) makes secure DNS over HTTPS (DoH) queries into private queries which prevent the leakage of client IP addresses to resolvers. The new proposed ODoH standard addresses this problem and today we are enabling users to use this protocol with 1.1.1.1
item.author: (Tanya Verma)

item.title: How to configure CSP Headers for Static Website Hosted in Azure Blob Storage
item.description: This post is about configuring CSP Header for Static Website Hosted in Azure Blob Storage. If you’re running a Single Page application, hosting it from Azure Blob service it easy and cost effective. Long back I wrote a blog post on how to do this - Simple Static Websites using Azure Blob service. One of the challenge in this approach is configuring security headers. If you check your application with tools like https://securityheaders.com, you will be getting a very low score, like F.

item.title: thought leaders and chicken sexers
item.description: From the moment I started paying attention to the tech industry, Paul Graham was there. My first job out of college was in SoMa, around the corner from the Justin.tv offices, and his essays were just floating around in the ether, impossible to ignore. His popularization of Lisp was a small part of why I tried Clojure, and a big part of why Clojure was successful.

item.title: Adopting Azure serverless architectures to help reduce CO2 emissions – Part 1 | Sustainable Software
item.description: Introduction Today most workloads run on provisioned servers and the demand for compute is increasing every day. However not all workloads need dedicated compute.
